thread.title: Iloka doubtful, Adam Jones questionable for Sunday's game
thread.title_full: Iloka doubtful, Adam Jones questionable for Sunday's game

title: Iloka doubtful, Adam Jones questionable for Sunday's game
text:
Iloka doubtful, Adam Jones questionable for Sunday's game 
Updated: Fri, Oct 02 2015, 02:51 PM 
CINCINNATI (Richard Skinner) -- Bengals starting safety George Iloka is listed as doubtful for Sunday's game against the Kansas City Chiefs n Paul Brown Stadium while starting cornerback Adam Jones is listed as questionable on the official NFL injury report released by the team on Friday. 
Iloka did not practice for the third straight day on Friday due to an ankle injury, while Jones was a full participant for the second straight day after missing on Wednesday with an elbow injury. 
Iloka took himself out of last Sunday's game at the Baltimore Ravens in the second half because of the injury and was replaced by Shawn Williams. Iloka played 43 defensive snaps in the game and Williams played 31. 
Williams will likely start in Iloka's place with veteran Leon Hall possibly moving to safety in nickel situations and thus opening the door for 2014 first-round draft pick Darqueze Dennard to see some playing time as the nickel corner. 
Jones suffered the elbow injury in the Baltimore game when he was tackled returning the opening kickoff of the second half. Jones appeared to be in significant pain both as he was treated on the field and then while on the sidelines as the offense was on the field, but returned for the first defensive snap of the second half and played the rest of the game. 
Three others Bengals players are listed probable for Sunday's game: cornerback Dre Kirkpatrick (shoulder); offensive tackle Andre Smith (hip) and defensive tackle Pat Sims (hip). All three were full participants in Friday's practice. 
Kirkpatrick got hurt trying to tackle Steve Smith as he crossed the goal line in the third quarter of Sunday's game in Baltimore, but remained in the game and played all 74 defensive snaps. 
Smith missed some practice time last week due to a buttocks injury, but played in Sunday's game. 
Sims missed the game due to his injury. 
Rookie defensive lineman Marcus Hardison is also listed as questionable due to the knee injury that caused him to miss the first three games of the season.
